page.title: 13THE FLOW
page.content: This block is mainly heather clad moorland on which black faced hill sheep are grazed. In autumn and winter, flocks of pink foot geese fly in and feed on the landaround a small loch called the Flow, rhyming with how. The geese fly daily between the Estuary of the Forth and the moor. Their numbers, although still substantial, are rather less than they were some ten years ago. During the shooting season, the gamekeeper who lives in the village, arranges grouse and pheasant shoots as required by his employers.
